verbose_definition: Use the noun welter to describe an enormous, messy pile, like the jumble of papers, coffee mugs, pens, and food wrappers on the desk of the messiest person in the office.

list_definition: situated at or extending to great depth
verbose_definition: When you need a word that's deeper than "deep," consider profound. A philosopher is likely to make many profound pronouncements.

list_definition: assign to a lower position
verbose_definition: Relegate means "to assign to a lower position." If the quarterback of the football team stops making decent throws, he might be relegated to the position of benchwarmer.

list_definition: full of anxiety and concern
verbose_definition: When you hear the word solicitous, think of your mom — attentive, caring, and concerned. It's nice when your waiter gives you good service, but if he or she is solicitous, the hovering might annoy you.

list_definition: very thin in gauge or diameter
verbose_definition: If something is tenuous it's thin, either literally or metaphorically. If you try to learn a complicated mathematical concept by cramming for 45 minutes, you will have a tenuous grasp of that concept, at best.

list_definition: determined by chance or impulse rather than by necessity
verbose_definition: Whimsical means full of or characterized by whims, which are odd ideas that usually occur to you very suddenly. If you decide at the last minute to fly to Europe, you could say you went there on a whim.

list_definition: tending to discourage, especially of prices
verbose_definition: That expensive Ferrari in the showroom? You may want it, but its price is prohibitive — which means the price is discouragingly high and likely to deter you from buying.

list_definition: express criticism towards
verbose_definition: Reproach means to mildly criticize. If you show poor manners at your grandmother's dinner table, she will reproach you.

list_definition: inducing sleep
verbose_definition: Something that is soporific is sleep-inducing. Certain medicines, but also extreme coziness, can have a soporific effect.

list_definition: a speech of violent denunciation
verbose_definition: A tirade is a speech, usually consisting of a long string of violent, emotionally charged words. Borrow and lose your roommate’s clothes one too many times, and you can bet you’ll be treated to a heated tirade.

list_definition: a fervent and even militant proponent of something
verbose_definition: The hamburger zealot was so fanatical about his burgers that he camped outside his favorite fast-food joint for hours every morning, waiting for it to open. And he would never put mustard on them, only ketchup.

list_definition: grow rapidly
verbose_definition: When something proliferates, it's growing, spreading or multiplying really quickly. Bunny rabbits have a habit of proliferating, as do dandelions in untended gardens and funny YouTube videos on the internet.

list_definition: a person without moral scruples
verbose_definition: There's no way around it, a reprobate is a bad egg. The black sheep of the family, missing a moral compass — a reprobate's been called everything from a deviant to an evildoer to a scoundrel.

list_definition: plausible but false
verbose_definition: Use specious to describe an argument that seems to be good, correct, or logical, but is not so. We live on the earth, therefore the earth must be the center of the universe has been proven to be a specious theory of the solar system.

list_definition: a state of motor and mental inactivity
verbose_definition: Torpor is a state of mental and physical inactivity. "After a huge Thanksgiving meal, my family members fall into a torpor; no one can even pick up the TV remote."

list_definition: a natural inclination
verbose_definition: A propensity is a natural tendency to behave in a certain way. We all have propensities — things we tend to do. Dogs have a propensity to bark, and many people have a propensity for getting annoyed by it.

list_definition: refuse to acknowledge, ratify, or recognize as valid
verbose_definition: To repudiate something is to reject it, or to refuse to accept or support it. If you grow up religious, but repudiate all organized religion as an adult, you might start spending holidays at the movies, or just going to work.

list_definition: a broad range of related objects, values, or qualities
verbose_definition: A spectrum is a broad range of similar things or qualities, like the wide spectrum of political beliefs in this country, ranging anywhere from super conservative to über-liberal and everything in between.

list_definition: marked by repeated turns and bends
verbose_definition: Tortuous means twisting or complicated. "James Bond drove up a mountain road that was tortuous in its twists and turns. He had to stop the evil madman's plan for world domination, a plan so tortuous that even 007 himself could not understand it."
